item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Right now 0 yak is still available, check to see if you have the right one..

THIS EVENT DEPENDS ON WEATHER CONDITIONS BEING "GOOD" Since its a long drive for most and that this area will take a several hours to explore the Fenton River and later the River near the Airport to the south while tarveling through the center of the Reservoir.
After the paddling event is also the Pot Luck Picknick nearby.

Rain, Winds above 10 mph and cold weather Cancells the event.

I will update weather info before the event day.

So far its looking like a good weekend..

If it dosent look like a good enough paddling day i will substitute a local walk with some kind of Feature on my other site.

Getting There:
Mansfield Hollow Boat Launch:

for GPS use 300 Bassetts Bridge Road Mansfield Center CT, (its close enough)..
mapquest or other...just compare the directions below to what you get..they better be similar..

The meetup map link above looks ok.

From I-84 heading EAST, take Exit 68 = south on rte 195 through Storrs to Mansfield ctr (about 11 miles from 84)
Go 0.5 mile past rte 89 junction and turn left onto Bassset Bridge Rd at the stoplight, should see Mansfield Hollow Park sign. (licquer store at the intersection too)
Will see a picknick area on left but go a bit further apx 0.5 miles to the access right before the bridge on the left.

From I-384 East, bear right onto rte 6 and follow rte 6 to toward Willimantic.
6 and 66 will intersect at a light. Take a left on to 6.
Follow this highway to the second exit, go straight (=rte633 or s. frontage rd.) it is actually a parallel to rte 6 connector to rte 195,
Signs for UCONN should be there somewhere too,
Go North on rte 195 toward UCONN for about 2 miles then turn right at the onto Basset Bridge Rd, Will see a picknick area on left but go a bit further apx 0.5 miles to the access right before the bridge on the left.

The picknick area you passed will be where we go after the paddling is done.

Remember and PRINT the directions....LOL

Ok bring some food, and other stuff for several hours on the water and the picknick after.

Available Kayaks are:

I have 3 kayaks available but would like a rental doughnation of 15 bucks for each one.
It buys new stuff, repairs, transportation and the like.
Yes i want some more carbon Werners paddles, but the 400 bucks each..maybe one a year..LOL
I have 2 carbon paddles ordered, might be ready for this event..dont know ??
The cobra floor drain is now sealed.

Please know the kayak type and its quirks before reserving.

Depending on some conditions its ok to try different kayaks given your abilities..

Pfd, Paddle and other accessories included.

The Brown Homeless Bathtub, Recreational Kayak= Pungo 12' with F/R floataion bags installed= IRA


The Blue Flipper & Dipper, Sea Kayak= Riot Tourlite 15'= Al-r

The Yellow Bananna Snake, Sea Kayak= Cobra Expidition SOT 18', = NEIL

The Red Wild Dancer, Sea Kayak= Eddyline Wind Dancer 18'= DURELLE

The Red Flat Boat, Sea Kayak= NDK Greenlander Pro 18'= Alex

See you there.
AL-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Kayak Trailer and Orange Stryped Cones at boat "CARRY IN" area

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: *KAYAK EVENT* Mansfield Hollow Reservoir Areas
